Size: Up to 1.5 m tall and 3 m wide.
Stem: Greyish-green, cylindrical, with extremely sharp spines up to 4 cm long.
Flowers: Pink or purplish, up to 5 cm across.
FruitSeeds: Oval shaped, up to 5 cm long, turning yellow when ripe.
DistinguishingFeatures: Hudson pear (*Cylindropuntia pallida*) has larger pink to purple flowers. Jumping cholla (*Cylindropuntia prolifera*) is larger and has shorter spines. Rope pear (*Cylindropuntia imbricata*) is much larger and has larger flowers.
